Submodules#

game.factory.tool_data.t_csv module#

Last Change: 2023/aug/16 11:28 Author: Ryen Zhao

class game.factory.tool_data.t_csv.CSV(filename, separator, mode)[source]#

Bases: object

Object Class: CSV

Date: 2023/Aug/16

Author: Ryen Zhao

A CSV file object with functions to process data

Variables:

  • filename (str) – the path to the file

  • separator (str) – the delimiter for CSV file

  • mode (str) – to identify if the file is new or already exist

Append(content: list | None) → None[source]#

Append content to the CSV file.

Parameters:

content (list or None) – A list containing data to append to the CSV file. Can be None.

OverWrite(head: list | None, content: list | None) → None[source]#

Overwrite the target file with new head and content.

Parameters:

  • head (list) – The header for the new table.

  • content (list) – The content to be written.

Read() → list[source]#

Read the contents of the target file. :return: A 2D list with the same data and structure of the origin file. :rtype: list[list[int]]

game.factory.tool_data.t_sql module#

Last Change: 2023/aug/23 11:28 Author: Ryen Zhao

class game.factory.tool_data.t_sql.SQL(host, user, password, port, database)[source]#

Bases: object

A utility class for managing SQL database connections and operations.

This class provides a convenient way to establish a connection to an SQL database, retrieve a list of tables within a specified database, and execute various SQL queries.

Parameters:

  • host – The hostname or IP address of the database server.

  • user – The username for authenticating the database connection.

  • password – The password for authenticating the database connection.

  • port – The port number to use for the database connection.

  • database – The name of the database to operate on.

Variables:

  • database – The database connection object.

  • cursor – The cursor object for executing SQL queries.

  • table_list – A list of table names within the specified database.

get_table_by_name(table_name: str) → list[source]#

Fetch data from a specified table and return it as a list of dictionaries.

Parameters:

table_name – The name of the table to fetch data from.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries where ea ch dictionary represents a row of data.

get_tables() → list[source]#

Retrieve a list of table names in the specified database.

Returns:

A list of table names present in the specified database.
